thread.title: Ten teens shove girl, 16, onto Brooklyn subway tracks in robbery
thread.title_full: Ten teens shove girl, 16, onto Brooklyn subway tracks in robbery

author: ROCCO PARASCANDOLA
title: Ten teens shove girl, 16, onto Brooklyn subway tracks in robbery
text:
Ten teens shove girl, 16, onto Brooklyn subway tracks in robbery Ten teens shove girl, 16, onto Brooklyn subway tracks in robbery A 16-year-old girl was robbed and shoved to the subway tracks in Brooklyn in a frightening Sunday night confrontation with at least 10 other teens, police said Monday. (Isabel Slepoy/New York Daily News) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Monday,  43 AM 
A 16-year-old girl was robbed and shoved to the subway tracks in Brooklyn in a frightening confrontation with at least 10 other teens, police said Monday. 
The girl hurt her head but is expected to make a full recovery. 
The attack happened just after 8 p.m. Sunday at the Utica Ave. station on the IRT line in Crown Heights. 
The victim was on the southbound platform when 10 to 15 other teens, described as all boys who might know her, confronted her. 
She was shoved to the tracks, at which point two of the suspects jumped down onto the roadbed, beat her up, then stole her hat, navy blue jacket, school ID and $20. 
The victim was treated at Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center. 
The suspects were being sought Monday. Tags:
